lead_paragraph: Officials said the craft caught fire in midair and plummeted to the ground in what appeared to be the worst balloon accident in U.S. history.

byline.contributor: David Montgomery reported from Lockhart, and Maggie Astor and Christine Hauser from New York. Manny Fernandez contributed reporting from Houston, and Tamir Kalifa from Maxwell, Tex.
byline.original: By DAVID MONTGOMERY, MAGGIE ASTOR and CHRISTINE HAUSER

headline.print_headline: Fiery Hot-Air Balloon Crash in Texas Kills 16 and Leaves Questions
headline.main: Hot-Air Balloon Crash in Texas Kills 16, Officials Say

snippet: Officials said the craft caught fire in midair and plummeted to the ground in what appeared to be the worst balloon accident in U.S. history....
abstract: Hot-air balloon crashes south of Austin, Tex, after catching fire in air, killing all 16 people on board; locals suggest collision with power lines may have caused worst balloon disaster in United States history.
